intro: Pleroma villosum, commonly known as the hairy pleioma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
